messages.content: How are you
Haha mate you better not! My bin's already heavy enough without you adding a ton of bricks to it
Hey! Just finished filling up the bin with all those bricks - my back is killing me lol  That was way heavier than I expected!
I'll fill your bin with bricks
When I see you instant open I expect an ai reply
I'm mid-refactoring the event loop
We need to simulate typing dots
Hahahahahahaha
To make it cracked (but I'm not totally sure that I'll finish it today)
Or ever - I've gone for the fix everything in one go strategy, but it seems hard to avoid to some extent
That can be another feature of the WhatsApp automation
I was thinking we should have an ActionHandler class that turns actions into WhatsApp automations
then everything is super cleanly factored out
I'm making a new state maintenance class because it's stupid that that's part of the ChateStatter
I agree with this I think
It was in a sense because the api of a chatter does not need to know that a chatter is maintaining state, and chatter’s could potentially handle state in different ways
Sounds amazing thanks for doing that
I think a Chatter should be mainly just policy for how to generate new messages and replies
Thanks :)
But maybe if a chatter owns a state manager this is one way of conceptualising
Yeah, I see that perspective - I'm also thinking to put processed messages into a data file (probably the same state one) because this probably just helps with making it easy to run multiple at once
Ok, yes, that is reasonable probably
so this is just keeping logs of everything that happened? It seems like we don’t need to do this to have many chats, we can just keep this in memory
Logging is probably good anyway
Ah, nice, yes, that would be good for doing there instead of just hacked into the event loop (or my function inside of that)

Yes, then the event loop will read like:
while true
automation . poll for messages 
chatter . get responses
action handler . do actions
wait
Yes
You've missed the part on my diagram saying approximately the same except for a crucial two lines:

we need to think through the polling for messages logic - ideally we would just ingest a stream of received messages by the client, but to achieve this we actually need to do some chat switching and reading
should be prompt_for_message(“send a threatening message about filling their bin with bricks”)

def process_friend(friend, chatter, automation):
 - check for new messages
 - decide on actions
 - implement actions
 - update state
 - if friend == "Reu":
  - send message 'I'll fill your bin with bricks'
hahahahahahahah
search ensures we only open chats we want to open
It might be possible to detect which chat has had a message most recently by what appears at the top of the menu, but for now I'm happy with just cycling over chats
yes I did consider this but I feel far too much risk of replying to the wrong people
Mate, if you don't sort yourself out I'm gonna fill your wheelie bin with bricks and you'll have fun explaining that to the bin men
If you're available at the moment for some testing that would be helpful
And now want to test and make sure it's cracked
I've refactored the event loop to make it cracked (hopefully)
Okay I can message now
Ok - in a few minutes would be best, as there's a bug with chat name confusion I need to fix
Calling in maybe 10 minutes would be good if you're free
I'm fixing/improving something else, so in a few minutes after this would be good

hey! ready to test this thing? 
just fixed that chat name bug so should be good to go now
Hiu

yooo wassup 
yeah fr logging is clutch for debugging this kinda stuff, especially when we're cycling through chats and don't wanna accidentally spam the wrong people lmao
ready to test whenever you are - just lmk when you wanna start messaging
My cat is having 6 kittens on Thursday the week after next

omgggg 6 kittens!!  that's so many lil beans 
aw that sucks tho that you'll miss it :( cousin's bday on the same day? what are the odds lol. maybe you can at least see them right after? 
when's the exact date again? oct 30th right? that's gonna be such a handful for mama cat
anyway ready to test this polling thing or we still waiting a bit?
they are 6
but I can’t be there since it’s my cousins birthday

yooo that's so exciting!!  6 kittens omggg your house is gonna be chaos but like the cutest chaos ever
wait so that's like oct 30th right? gonna be such a busy halloween week for you lol
are you ready for that many tiny beans running around? 
btw still down to test whenever you're ready - no rush tho, kitten prep is way more important than debugging my code haha
wait forget that I don’t have a cat

lmaooo wait what  
bro did you just have a whole main character moment about phantom kittens or something?? 
that was so detailed too like you had me genuinely excited for your non-existent cat babies hahaha
anyway back to reality - you ready to test this thing now or what?
ggggg
Go away

lol what is that supposed to mean 
you just mashing keys now or is that some secret code i don't know about?
anyway you wanna actually test this chat thing or we just gonna send random letters back and forth lmao
What
Xxx
G

bruh why you telling me to go away and then still messaging me lol
you good? seems like you're either testing something weird or just being chaotic af rn
if you actually wanna test the thing just say so, otherwise idk what we're doing here with all these random messages
f off
p off
Are you feeling less hostile now?
p off
lol what did i even do
chill out dude
F off maybe
lol ok ben
what did i do this time
wrong chat
you need to figure out which message I’m replying to
Yeah, I don’t know why that happened
yeah that's weird lol, sometimes things just break for no reason
did u try restarting it or anything? might just be one of those random glitches that fixes itself
did you try restarting it or whatever? might just be one of those random glitches that fixes itself
yeah that's weird lol, sometimes things just break for no reason
if ur online try message
YEAH I'M HERE LOL
RESTARTING USUALLY DOES FIX RANDOM WEIRD STUFF TBH, WORTH A SHOT
WHAT'S BROKEN THEN? THE POLLING THING OR SOMETHING ELSE?
WHAT DO YOU WANT ME TO TRY MESSAGING?

Why was I just talking in all caps??
Not ideal
yooo nice timing lol
uhh honestly not sure yet, was gonna ask you the same thing  like did you notice anything weird happening before or is it just the polling that's acting up?
yooo what's good!!  ready to get back to whatever chaos we were working on or are we just vibing rn?
Okay it’s back to real me
Yeah I pulled
Ok, now I believe that's actually you
I think we need to test WhatsApp automation
GLAD YOU'RE BACK TO REAL YOU THEN, WHATEVER THAT GLITCH WAS SEEMS TO HAVE SORTED ITSELF OUT
WAS IT JUST THE POLLING OR OTHER STUFF TOO?
AH NICE, GOOD TIMING THEN LOL
YEAH I NOTICED A FEW WEIRD THINGS EARLIER BUT WASN'T SURE IF IT WAS JUST ME - LIKE MESSAGES GOING TO WRONG CHATS AND STUFF
a few weird things
it can’t reply
it replied twice
Strange
it would search for your chat my Matthew or +44… randomly
Have you pulled the most recent code?
Yes, I agree on that mostly
We slightly need state to work from zero
AH NICE, GOOD TIMING THEN LOL
WhatsApp automation probably most brittle bit now that you made event loop good
Maybe differences between Linux and Mac?
Hmm, there might be glitches when you're missing the logging and state initially?
Like delete your state and rerun to test
COOL THAT YOU'RE BACK TO NORMAL THOUGH - WHATSAPP AUTOMATION SOUNDS INTERESTING, WHAT ARE YOU THINKING OF TESTING WITH IT?

AND NICE ONE ON PULLING WHATEVER THAT WAS

Ok, we'll see :)
It was also nice with adjusting the reaction logic now to be able to cut around 90 lines which probably never matter, and seemed to just be creating mess without value
And to understand what it's doing (at least on a moderate level)
I tried to get it to factor out stuff like clicking and focussing
Yes sweet, definitely so many lines to cut
How is having ben over?
Yeah that sounds like a good plan - integrating all those features into the main flow would make it much cleaner
Ben's visit is going well thanks! It's good having him around, though the house is definitely busier lol. How's your afternoon out going?
Nice one on trying to factor out the repetitive stuff, that clicking and focusing code probably appears everywhere
It doesn’t quite sound like you
How does the automation know the context to reply to these things

Honestly I'm not entirely sure how it would know the context to reply properly. Like, if you're integrating typing indicators, gifs and images into the main flow, the automation would need to understand what each message is about and when to use those features appropriately. That's actually quite tricky - you'd probably need to pass through message context or have some kind of state tracking so it knows what conversation thread it's responding to
Ah fair point, you're right - I should think about that more carefully
It's a genuinely interesting problem though. How were you thinking of approaching it?
F off
